thread.title_full: Sydney CBD office and hotel asset ownership goes global

title: Sydney CBD office and hotel asset ownership goes global
text:
The Westin Hotel in Sydney sold for $445 million to Asian investors.
Investment in Sydney CBD office and hotel assets by offshore groups has grown considerably over the past five years.
To measure this growth, Knight Frank assessed the ownership of investment grade stock as at August 2015, compared with January 2010.
The globalisation thesis is clear-cut as offshore direct ownership of CBD office assets has increased from 16 per cent to 30 per cent of the market by value, while significant four and five-star hotel ownership has increased from 69 per cent of the rooms analysed to 88 per cent.
In the office sector, the assessed market value of the Sydney CBD investment grade database is $49.7 billion, covering 4.37 million square metres, of which 1.35 million square metres ($15 billion) is owned by offshore groups. This has more than doubled in square-metre terms since January 2010, and increased by 190 per cent in value terms. Boosting activity has been the strong inflow over the past year, with 56 per cent of office sales ($2.8 billion) to offshore groups.
Advertisement Over the same period, Greater China has had the strongest growth rate, up elevenfoldâ€‹ to $4.26 billion, accentuated recently by the Investa portfolio transaction to CIC, while North American investment also increased, most notably over the past 18 months. Canada has overtaken Singapore as the largest owner by country, with $3.45 billion of assets compared with $3.12 billion.
Since January 2010, about 857,000 square metres, or 44 per cent, of the total turnover of Knight Frank's database has transferred to offshore ownership. Secondary grade stock acquisitions have dominated sales activity. A significant driver has been the demand for large, non-prime assets with redevelopment/change of use potential. Dalian Wanda, Visionary and Shimao have been active participants.
In the hotel sector, analysis of four and five-star hotels in the Sydney CBD (10,850 rooms) shows that since 2010, 4825 rooms, or 45 per cent, of these hotels have sold and all to offshore groups. Recent significant sales include the Westin Hotel (Far East/Sino Group), the Hilton Hotel (Bright Ruby) and the Sheraton on the Park (Sunshine Insurance).
Asian ownership has increased to 8363 rooms. This is now 77 per cent, up from 51 per cent. Greater China increased from, effectively, zero to almost 2000 rooms or 18.4 per cent. Notwithstanding a slight decrease over the period, Singapore remains the dominant owner by country. It owns just over 3000 rooms or 29 per cent of total stock.
Matt Whitby is group director, head of research and consulting for Knight Frank Australia.
